Attention to the details
Experience in working with maps, geospatial data will be a plus

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. MITRE is seeking an experienced Market Data professional to continue the growth of our Market Intelligence capability in support of a diverse set of internal and external sponsors. The Market Data Analyst role involves consolidating multiple sources of data into a cleansed, enriched, and actionable data set that can be connected and modified to address key business questions. This role requires an individual that is comfortable with gathering and synthesizing the data, as well as applying strategic thinking to the curation, enrichment and augmentation of the data to enhance future analysis.

Target projects include cleansing and enriching large data sets following Federal contracted obligations, architecting data constructs and data dashboards, market analysis & modeling (overall market and sub-markets), creating connection between multiple data sets for end user analysis. The work also includes engaging with internal clients to scope and prioritize tasks, collecting and working with large datasets to perform data-driven analyses, and performing additional data research as necessary. This position supports other department capabilities in business analyses, strategy, and market intelligence as needed.

This position will interact with all levels of the company, including senior level managers, technical SMEs, and analysts. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience performing market analysis on government funding/budget, industry trends, and market participants, an entrepreneurial approach to generating and creating value and impact, and an appreciation for a nonprofit/public interest environment.

Roles & Responsibilities:


Work as part of a dynamic team environment where tasks are rarely routine and often require novel approaches.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, with limited structure and supervision.
Assist in identifying sources of information and gathering a wide range of quantitative and qualitative data to support decisions that have implications for MITRE and its government sponsors
Apply analysis skills, including exploratory data analysis to organize, analyze, and synthesize data into consumable deliverables
Assist in developing data visualization dashboards and deliverables that improve the presentation of complex data sets
Translate unstructured data and nontraditional sources of information into dashboards for business insights
Create data baselines for various market segments and businesses
Obtain, merge, reshape, clean, and evaluate the quality of datasets associated with various markets; work with developers to, where applicable, automate data pulls, manipulation, and other activities to enable efficient operations
Work with cross-functional data architecture, data science and support roles to enhance data automation and visualizations
Assist in analysis, transition, and improvement at multiple levels of data architecture design and execution


Basic Qualifications:


Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in: Business, Data Science, Operations, Data Analytics, or related field and a minimum of 2 years of related experience in domains such as data analytics, market analytics, market modeling, data architecture; or an advanced degree with relevant experience who can immediately contribute at this job step; or equivalent combination of related education and work experience.
Experience with data analysis, data architecture, and visualization tools, Python, SQL, Tableau and experience with cloud data warehouses
Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated skills and experience in presenting analytical results both verbally and in writing
This position requires a minimum of 50% hybrid on-site


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s in Business Administration or another related field
Understanding of U.S. government funding data sources and experience with/knowledge of the government contracting market
Experience in government contractor consulting and/or in an environment monitoring federal policy and/or appropriations
Knowledge of the federal R&D environment and the role and value of federally-funded research and development centers

Title: Business & Data Analyst Intern or Co-Op
Description:
Schneider Electric has a new opportunity for a Business & Data Analyst Intern or Co-Op. This position will be based in Foxboro, MA with a target start date of January 2025. We are looking for a talented and motivated individual with a robust background in market trend assessment, leveraging advanced technological methods such as statistical techniques, machine learning, and data visualization tools. The candidate will apply their expertise in market assessment, programming skills, and analytical abilities to foster data-driven decision-making and contribute to various business development initiatives. In addition to that the candidate shall perform the analysis of humongous operational data sets of the plants, identifying the gaps and suggesting the areas of improvement that can unlock great value.

What will you do?


Market Research: Conduct comprehensive market analyses to support business strategies and enhance competitive positioning.
Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for optimizing industrial processes and improving efficiency based on your analyses.
Data Applications: Design, develop, and maintain data-driven applications and dashboards using tools such as Python, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Analytical Techniques: Apply machine learning and statistical techniques to analyze business data and develop predictive models that inform strategic decisions.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams using Agile methodologies to execute projects aimed at improving operational efficiency.
Statistical Validation: Utilize statistical analysis methods (e.g., T-tests, Chi-Square, ANOVA) to validate findings and support business recommendations.
Presentation Skills: Develop and deliver engaging presentations on data insights and visualization techniques to stakeholders.


Required Skills:


Proficiency in programming languages and tools: Python, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Advanced Excel.
Strong understanding of machine learning applications in business, including predictive modeling and dashboard development.
Familiarity with frameworks and methodologies such as Agile, SDLC, and various statistical analysis techniques.


Experience:


Proven experience in working with Innovation projects working in all aspects across Desirability, Viability & Feasibility.
Proven experience in identifying market opportunities and segmenting the market, including sizing market potential.
Background in machine learning or programming, demonstrating the ability to analyze data related to Industrial Automation assets and enhance operational efficiency (e.g., improving uptime, throughput, and energy efficiency).
Demonstrated project experience in developing dashboards or predictive models to drive financial insights or performance improvements.


Education:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has an enterprise client seeking a Data Engineer I in North Reading, MA. Summary: As a Data Engineer you will contribute to the development of a data lake and data services. You will be developing and supporting the analytic technologies that give our customers timely, flexible and structured access to their data. The Data Engineer I will be responsible for designing and implementing a platform using third-party and in-house reporting tools, modeling metadata. You will work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing solutions to support analytical and reporting needs.

Python
SQL

Description:
At Klaviyo, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives each Klaviyo (we call ourselves Klaviyos) brings to our workplace each and every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. Klaviyo is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst or Senior Analyst to join our growing team. This person will be focused on analyzing data to drive business impact and understanding. They will contribute to building models and maintaining data environments. They will also be asked to perform analyses on various aspects of Klaviyo’s business and operations and present findings to key stakeholders within the company.

How You'll Make a Difference


This is a cross functional role that requires framing business problems, maintaining data needed for analysis, synthesizing results and making recommendations to the executive team and other leaders in various departments.
Perform hypothesis testing and causal analyses to statistically assess relative impact and extract trends.
Create analysis frameworks to effectively answer strategic questions.
Interact with customer success, support, product, engineering, sales, and marketing functions.
Contribute to development of models around predictive recommendations, marketing attribution, financial forecasts, etc. to support the best decision making within the organization.
Typical business issues will involve framing and solving problems around areas such as acquisition channels, drivers of churn and customer retention, product engagement, program impact on customer behavior, etc.


Who You Are

You are quantitative and curious. You enjoy understanding cause and effect in various business situations. You enjoy finding creative technical solutions to hard problems and are structured in your thinking. Ideal for someone who wants to launch a career in business analytics.


2-4 years of analytical experience with data and data modeling concepts
Engineering, data science, statistics, economics or quantitative background
Experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python, Stata, MATLAB, etc.).
Deep experience with SQL and relational databases (Redshift, Snowflake preferred)
Familiarity with ETL tools and frameworks (Stitch, HEVO, etc)
Very curious about what makes a business / operation function successful
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner. Art of telling a story with data.

• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Title: Analyst, Claims - Data Science
Description:
Pay Philosophy

The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

Description

The creative problem solvers in Liberty Mutual’s Insights & Solutions group harness the power of data, analytics and technology to develop innovative solutions that drive our US Retail Markets business forward and support a high-performing culture. This group brings together highly talented thinkers and doers ready to challenge the status quo and make an impact. As a member of this cross-functional group, you’ll collaborate with teams across Liberty Mutual to deliver analysis that unlocks insights and sparks new, better ways of working.

The US Retail Markets Data Science team brings together a diverse range of talent to predict future risk and what our customers will need to recover. Our data engineers write code that turns trillions of bits of information into structured data—data that our hundred-plus Data Scientists analyze with cutting-edge modeling techniques to unlock insights. From there, our tools and deployment teams ensure this data can be practically applied to business problems across US Retail Markets. Join us and be a part of this dynamic group driving industry-leading data segmentation, fueling the team’s success now and into the future.

The USRM Claims Data Science team is hiring two Analyst I, Data Science, roles as part of a broader expansion of our team. One role will focus on Property claims, and the other role will focus on Casualty claims.

Claims data science is bursting with opportunity. Recent advances in Large Language Models, Computer Vision, and other technologies bring many previously impracticable business challenges into the realm of possibility for data scientists. Claims data science can be a key competitive advantage for Liberty Mutual in the years to come; help us build that competitive advantage!

As an Analyst I, Data Science, you will gain experience in collaborating with business partners to develop predictive models that enable dynamic software systems and data-driven strategic decision-making. This role utilizes data science techniques to manipulate large structured and unstructured data sets, identify patterns in raw data, and develop models to predict the likelihood of a future outcome and/or to optimize business solutions.

This level focuses on gaining industry knowledge, development of predictive analytics techniques, and obtaining experience in writing high-quality code and storytelling with data.


This role may have in-office requirements based on candidate location.**


Responsibilities


Collaborates with claims process, experience, technology, and analytics teams to help create the most accurate, caring, and efficient claims organization in the insurance industry.
Applies data science techniques; gains confidence in skill application using analytics and data science techniques to manipulate large structured and unstructured data sets in order to generate insights to inform business decisions.
Follows ML Ops best practices to create organized code repos, production-quality code, and reproducible results.
Identifies and tests hypotheses, ensuring statistical significance, as part of building predictive models for business application.
Translates quantitative analyses and findings into accessible visuals for non-technical audiences, providing a clear view into interpreting the data.
Gains experience in enabling the business to make clear tradeoffs between and among choices, with a reasonable view into likely outcomes.
Assists in customizing analytic solutions to specific client needs.
Responsible for smaller components of projects considered low to moderate complexity and may work on smaller components of complex projects.
Engages with the Data Science community.
Participates in cross functional working groups.


Qualifications


Solid knowledge of predictive analytics techniques and statistical diagnostics of models.
Advance knowledge of predictive toolset; expert resource for tool development.
Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely.
Has a value-driven perspective with regard to understanding of work context and impact.
Competencies typically acquired through a Master’s degree (scientific field of study) and 0-1 years of relevant experience or a Bachelor’s degree (scientific field of study) and 3+ years of relevant experience.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. We are looking for a talented and motivated individual with a robust background in market trend assessment, leveraging advanced technological methods such as statistical techniques, machine learning, and data visualization tools. The candidate will apply their expertise in market assessment, programming skills, and analytical abilities to foster data-driven decision-making and contribute to various business development initiatives. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for optimizing industrial processes and improving efficiency based on your analyses.
Data Applications: Design, develop, and maintain data-driven applications and dashboards using tools such as Python, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.

Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams using Agile methodologies to execute projects aimed at improving operational efficiency.
Statistical Validation: Utilize statistical analysis methods (e.g., T-tests, Chi-Square, ANOVA) to validate findings and support business recommendations.
Presentation Skills: Develop and deliver engaging presentations on data insights and visualization techniques to stakeholders.


Required Skills:


Proficiency in programming languages and tools: Python, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Advanced Excel.
Strong understanding of machine learning applications in business, including predictive modeling and dashboard development.
Familiarity with frameworks and methodologies such as Agile, SDLC, and various statistical analysis techniques.


Experience:


Proven experience in working with Innovation projects working in all aspects across Desirability, Viability & Feasibility.
Proven experience in identifying market opportunities and segmenting the market, including sizing market potential.
Background in machine learning or programming, demonstrating the ability to analyze data related to Industrial Automation assets and enhance operational efficiency (e.g., improving uptime, throughput, and energy efficiency).
Demonstrated project experience in developing dashboards or predictive models to drive financial insights or performance improvements.


Education:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
